title: Felipe Massa claims Lewis Hamilton will surpass Michael Schumacher as F1's greatest ever
text:

Felipe Massa believes Lewis Hamilton will break every F1 record and surpass Michael Schumacher as the greatest of all time.

Hamilton can win his sixth world championship if results go his way at tomorrow evening’s Mexican Grand Prix.

It will put the Mercedes ace just one title behind Schumacher - and his former rival believes he can become the “most important” name in motorsport history.

Massa, a former Ferrari team-mate of Schumacher, agonisingly missed out on the world title on the last lap of the 2008 season as Hamilton secured his first crown.

And the Brazilian, who now drives in the ever-growing Formula E series, says Hamilton has never looked back since.

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: REUTERS)

“I think he is an amazing driver,” Massa said. “What he is showing to Formula One is that he can be the most important name in Formula One history soon.

“I think he has a proper talent for everything. A proper talent for taking the best out of the car in qualifying, a proper talent for taking the best out of the car in the race, a proper feeling of the car in the wet. I think he is a complete driver.

“It is something that you could see when Ayrton Senna was driving, when Michael Schumacher was racing and winning everything. (Juan Manuel) Fangio as well, Jackie Stewart. He is absolutely complete.”

However, Massa has warned that the impending rule changes that are proposed for 2021 could end the dominance of Mercedes in F1.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Massa sits in the world council meetings that decide on rule changes in his role as president of the CIK for karting.

But while he understands change could be frustrating for Hamilton, they are essential for the future of the sport.

“The mentality is that they have to change, or the sport can die,” he said.

“The changes need to be done for the sport, for the budget. Nobody can spend that amount of money anymore - even the big companies.

“This can make a big effect at the end, and for the show. Something needs to be done.”

(Image: GETTY)

As for Hamilton, Massa added: “You always need to wait and see which car he is going to have. This is the most important thing - you have to have the car to win. If he has the car to win, he can make the difference as a driver.

“Maybe next year he can have the car to win, because the rules remain the same.

“The year after, the rules will change so we need to wait and see, but I really believe that he can beat all the records.”
description: EXCLUSIVE: Massa, who now drives in the ever-growing Formula E, believes that Hamilton will go on to break every possible record
